bill_title: prohibit certain young drivers from using a cellular telephone while operating a motor vehicle.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit certain young drivers from using a cellular telephone while operating a motor vehicle. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-26 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No person with an instruction permit or a restricted minor's permit may operate a motor vehicle while using a cellular telephone or other wireless telecommunications device, except to report an emergency. For the purposes of this section, the term, using, means talking, listening, or placing or receiving a call on any cellular telephone or other wireless telecommunications device, or operating its keys, buttons, or other controls. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.038 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit certain young drivers from using a cellular telephone while operating a motor vehicle. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-26 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No person with an instruction permit or a restricted minor's permit may drive a motor vehicle while using a cellular telephone or other wireless telecommunications device, except to report an emergency. For the purposes of this section, the term, using, means talking, listening, or placing or receiving a call on any cellular telephone or other wireless telecommunications device, or operating its keys, buttons, or other controls. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.038 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
